newsitem.title: USA: Missing kids' pictures to feature on phone cards.
newsitem.headline: Missing kids' pictures to feature on phone cards.

text.p: Pictures of missing children, for many years printed regularly on the side of milk cartons in the hope someone will recognize them, will now show up on some prepaid phone cards.
GTE Card Services Inc, a unit of GTE Corp, said Tuesday it was introducing a prepaid phone card with the picture of a missing child on the front of each one.
It said five percent of the cards' retail value will go to Child Watch of North America, a non-profit group that helps parents search for their missing children.
Don Wood, the group's director, said people use phone cards over and over again so the children's faces will become ingrained in their memories.
That, he said, will likely make the cards more effective in finding missing kids than milk cartons or posters. "There's no question we'll find children with these cards."
